TITLE: Ignoring Members by Predicate in C# Verify Tests
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to ignore members using predicate functions in Verify tests. It includes examples for ignoring members based on name and type, as well as ignoring dictionary entries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/serializer-settings.md#2025-04-22_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
[Fact]
public Task IgnoreMemberByPredicate()
{
    var target = new IgnoreExplicitTarget
    {
        Include = "Value",
        Field = "Value",
        Property = "Value",
        PropertyByName = "Value"
    };
    var settings = new VerifySettings();

    settings.IgnoreMembers(_ => _ is "Field" or "Property");
    settings.IgnoreMembers(_ => _.Name is "PropertyByName" or "PropertyThatThrows");

    return Verify(target, settings);
}

[Fact]
public Task IgnoreMemberByPredicateFluent()
{
    var target = new IgnoreExplicitTarget
    {
        Include = "Value",
        Field = "Value",
        Property = "Value",
        PropertyByName = "Value"
    };
    var settings = new VerifySettings();

    return Verify(target, settings)
        .IgnoreMembers(_ => _ is "Field" or "Property")
        .IgnoreMembers(_ => _.Name is "PropertyByName" or "PropertyThatThrows");
}

[Fact]
public Task IgnoreDictionaryByPredicate()
{
    var settings = new VerifySettings();

    settings.IgnoreMembers(name => name is "Ignore");

    var target = new Dictionary<string, object>
    {
        {
            "Include", new Dictionary<string, string>
            {
                {
                    "Ignore", "Value1"
                },
                {
                    "Key1", "Value2"
                }
            }
        },
        {
            "Ignore", "Value3"
        },
        {
            "Key2", "Value4"
        }
    };
    return Verify(target, settings);
}
```

TITLE: Copying Verify Received Files to Artifact Staging
DESCRIPTION: Copies all *.received.* files to the artifact staging directory when the publishverify flag is set. This step is necessary since PublishBuildArtifacts doesn't support wildcards directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_NUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Implementing Custom Path Derivation for AppVeyor in C#
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to implement custom path derivation for .verified files when using AppVeyor as the build server. It uses the DerivePathInfo method to handle scenarios where test assemblies are copied to different directories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/build-server.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
DerivePathInfo(
    (sourceFile, projectDirectory, type, method) =>
    {
        var testDirectory = Path.GetDirectoryName(sourceFile);
        var testAssemblyDirectory = Path.GetDirectoryName(type.Assembly.Location);
        var testAssemblyName = Path.GetFileName(testAssemblyDirectory);
        var projectName = Path.GetFileName(Path.GetDirectoryName(projectDirectory));
        var ci = Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("CI");
        if (ci == "true")
        {
            var appVeyorProjectDirectory = Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("APPVEYOR_BUILD_FOLDER");
            var appVeyorTestDirectory = Path.Combine(
                appVeyorProjectDirectory,
                projectName,
                testAssemblyName);
            testDirectory = appVeyorTestDirectory;
        }

        return new(testDirectory, type.Name, method.Name);
    });
```

TITLE: Setting up a verification test for asynchronous code with Verify.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a test that verifies the behavior of a promise-returning function. It uses the verify library to check that the function properly resolves after a timeout.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/StrictJsonTests/SerializationTests.ScrubEmptyLinesStart.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
verify(function() {
  var d = $.Deferred();
  setTimeout(function() {
    d.resolve("done");
  }, 100);
  return d.promise();
}, function(r) {
  return r === "done";
});
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps Pipeline Configuration for Publishing Received Files
DESCRIPTION: Azure DevOps pipeline YAML configuration that publishes the staged *.received.* files as build artifacts when tests fail, making them available for review.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Other_Cli_TUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Scrubbing Numeric Ids in C# Verify Tests
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to scrub numeric Ids in Verify tests using ScrubMembers. It defines a Target class with an Id and Name property, sets up custom scrubbing logic, and runs a test to verify the scrubbing behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/numeric-ids.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
public class NumericIdSample
{
    public class Target : IHasId
    {
        public required int Id { get; init; }
        public required string Name { get; init; }
    }

    [ModuleInitializer]
    public static void Init() =>
        VerifierSettings.ScrubMembers(
            _ => typeof(IHasId).IsAssignableFrom(_.DeclaringType) &&
                 _.Name == "Id");

    [Fact]
    public Task Test()
    {
        var target = new Target
        {
            Id = new Random().Next(),
            Name = "The Name"
        };
        return Verify(target);
    }

    public interface IHasId
    {
        public int Id { get; init; }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Text Scrubbers in Fixie Tests
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows text scrubbing techniques using the Fixie test framework. It includes methods for line replacement, removal, and handling empty lines. The code demonstrates both settings-based and fluent configurations for scrubbing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/scrubbers.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
public class ScrubbersSample
{
    public Task Lines()
    {
        var settings = new VerifySettings();
        settings.ScrubLinesWithReplace(
            replaceLine: _ =>
            {
                if (_.Contains("LineE"))
                {
                    return "NoMoreLineE";
                }

                return _;
            });
        settings.ScrubLines(removeLine: _ => _.Contains('J'));
        settings.ScrubLinesContaining("b", "D");
        settings.ScrubLinesContaining(StringComparison.Ordinal, "H");
        return Verify(
            settings: settings,
            target: """
                    LineA
                    LineB
                    LineC
                    LineD
                    LineE
                    LineH
                    LineI
                    LineJ
                    "");
    }

    public Task LinesFluent() =>
        Verify("""
               LineA
               LineB
               LineC
               LineD
               LineE
               LineH
               LineI
               LineJ
               """)
            .ScrubLinesWithReplace(
                replaceLine: _ =>
                {
                    if (_.Contains("LineE"))
                    {
                        return "NoMoreLineE";
                    }

                    return _;
                })
            .ScrubLines(removeLine: _ => _.Contains('J'))
            .ScrubLinesContaining("b", "D")
            .ScrubLinesContaining(StringComparison.Ordinal, "H");

    public Task RemoveOrReplace() =>
        Verify("""
               LineA
               LineB
               LineC
               """)
            .ScrubLinesWithReplace(
                replaceLine: line =>
                {
                    if (line.Contains("LineB"))
                    {
                        return null;
                    }

                    return line.ToLower();
                });

    public Task EmptyLines() =>
        Verify("""

               LineA

               LineC

               """)
            .ScrubEmptyLines();
}
```

TITLE: Creating a Basic Verify Test with Expecto - F#
DESCRIPTION: This F# sample demonstrates writing an Expecto test that verifies the output of ClassBeingTested.FindPerson using snapshot verification. It uses the Verifier.Verify method and defines a testTask within an Expecto test list. Required dependencies: Expecto, VerifyTests, VerifyExpecto. Inputs are the string \"findPerson\" (the test name) and the value returned from FindPerson. Output is a snapshot assertion or failure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudio_Gui_Expecto_None.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: f#
CODE:
```
open Expecto\nopen VerifyTests\nopen VerifyExpecto\n\n[<Tests>]\nlet tests =\n    testTask \"findPerson\" {\n        let person = ClassBeingTested.FindPerson()\n        do! Verifier.Verify(\"findPerson\", person).ToTask()\n    }
```

TITLE: Copying Verify .received Files to Staging Directory in Azure DevOps Pipeline (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines a CopyFiles task that copies all .received files to a staging directory. It only runs if the 'publishverify' variable is set to 'Yes', indicating that the test runner failed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Gui_Expecto_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Publishing Verify Received Files as Build Artifacts in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: This YAML task publishes the staged .received files as build artifacts when the publishverify flag is set to Yes. This allows for easier debugging of failed verification tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Cli_Fixie_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying Received Files to Artifact Staging in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: Copy task that stages *.received.* files for publishing as artifacts when tests fail in Azure DevOps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Gui_MSTest_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')

    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Implementing Fixie Test Project Configuration for Verify
DESCRIPTION: Creates a custom TestProject class that implements ITestProject and IExecution interfaces to properly configure Verify with Fixie. This setup assigns the target assembly and properly wraps test executions with ExecutionState.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Rider_Gui_Fixie_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
public class TestProject :
    ITestProject,
    IExecution
{
    public void Configure(TestConfiguration configuration, TestEnvironment environment)
    {
        VerifierSettings.AssignTargetAssembly(environment.Assembly);
        configuration.Conventions.Add<DefaultDiscovery, TestProject>();
    }

    public async Task Run(TestSuite testSuite)
    {
        foreach (var testClass in testSuite.TestClasses)
        {
            foreach (var test in testClass.Tests)
            {
                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()
                                 .Select(_ => _.Parameters))
                    {
                        using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, parameters))
                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);
                        }
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring AppVeyor to Capture .received Files on Test Failure
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell script for AppVeyor's on_failure build step that captures all .received files as build artifacts. Uses Get-ChildItem to recursively find .received files and Push-AppveyorArtifact to upload them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_MSTest_AppVeyor.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
on_failure:
  - ps: Get-ChildItem *.received.* -recurse | % { Push-AppveyorArtifact $_.FullName -FileName $_.Name }
```

tab_width = unset

This enforces best practices by requiring test assertions or awaited tasks not to be ignored. Append this to your .editorconfig to activate stricter static analysis for Verify usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_TUnit_None.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: editorconfig

```

```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: Upload Test Results
  if: failure()
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:

    path: |
      **/*.received.*
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'

    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps YAML for Publishing Verify Received Files
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for Azure DevOps to publish *.received.* files as artifacts when tests fail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Cli_XunitV3_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'

- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true

- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: EditorConfig Settings for Verified/Received Files
DESCRIPTION: Specifies recommended EditorConfig rules to enforce encoding, newline, and whitespace conventions for '*.verified.*' and '*.received.*' files. Ensures editors handle encoding as UTF-8 with BOM and line endings as LF, prevents extra trailing newlines. Place in an .editorconfig file at the project or repo root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudio_Gui_MSTest_AppVeyor.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
# Verify settings\n[*.{received,verified}.{json,txt,xml}]\ncharset = \"utf-8-bom\"\nend_of_line = lf\nindent_size = unset\nindent_style = unset\ninsert_final_newline = false\ntab_width = unset\ntrim_trailing_whitespace = false
```

TITLE: Uploading Received Files as AppVeyor Artifacts on Failure
DESCRIPTION: Configures an AppVeyor build (`appveyor.yml`) using the `on_failure` step to execute a PowerShell script. The script (`ps: Get-ChildItem ...`) finds all `*.received.*` files recursively within the build workspace and uploads them as build artifacts using the `Push-AppveyorArtifact` command. This makes the differing received files easily accessible for debugging failed builds in AppVeyor.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Cli_Fixie_AppVeyor.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
on_failure:
  - ps: Get-ChildItem *.received.* -recurse | % { Push-AppveyorArtifact $_.FullName -FileName $_.Name }
```

TITLE: Verifying Dictionary Operations in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet tests various dictionary operations in Python, including creation, accessing and modifying elements, and using dictionary methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.MSTest.DerivePaths.Tests/Tests.ThrowOnConflict.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
my_dict = {"a": 1, "b": 2, "c": 3}
assert my_dict["a"] == 1
assert "b" in my_dict
assert "d" not in my_dict
assert len(my_dict) == 3

my_dict["d"] = 4
assert my_dict == {"a": 1, "b": 2, "c": 3, "d": 4}
del my_dict["a"]
assert my_dict == {"b": 2, "c": 3, "d": 4}
assert list(my_dict.keys()) == ["b", "c", "d"]
assert list(my_dict.values()) == [2, 3, 4]
assert list(my_dict.items()) == [("b", 2), ("c", 3), ("d", 4)]

popped = my_dict.pop("b")
assert popped == 2
assert my_dict == {"c": 3, "d": 4}

my_dict.update({"e": 5, "f": 6})
assert my_dict == {"c": 3, "d": 4, "e": 5, "f": 6}

my_dict.clear()
assert my_dict == {}
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps YAML for Publishing Verify Received Files
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for Azure DevOps to publish *.received.* files as artifacts when tests fail, aiding in debugging and verification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Cli_TUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'

- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true

- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Treating Unused Pure Method Return Values as Errors - .editorconfig
DESCRIPTION: This snippet adds a rule to the .editorconfig file instructing ReSharper to treat situations where the return value of a pure method (such as Verify()) is not used as an error. This enforces best practices and reduces mistakes in snapshot-based test code. It requires ReSharper or Rider as the editor.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_Fixie_None.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: editorconfig

TITLE: Configuring Fixie for Verify Integration
DESCRIPTION: A TestProject class implementing ITestProject and IExecution interfaces to properly configure Fixie for use with Verify, including target assembly assignment and test execution state management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Rider_Gui_Fixie_AppVeyor.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
public class TestProject :
    ITestProject,
    IExecution
{
    public void Configure(TestConfiguration configuration, TestEnvironment environment)
    {
        VerifierSettings.AssignTargetAssembly(environment.Assembly);
        configuration.Conventions.Add<DefaultDiscovery, TestProject>();
    }

    public async Task Run(TestSuite testSuite)
    {
        foreach (var testClass in testSuite.TestClasses)
        {
            foreach (var test in testClass.Tests)
            {
                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()
                                 .Select(_ => _.Parameters))
                    {
                        using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, parameters))
                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);
                        }
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Copying Verify's .received Files to Azure DevOps Artifact Staging Directory
DESCRIPTION: A YAML task that copies all .received files to the artifact staging directory. This step is conditionally executed based on the publishverify variable set in the previous task, ensuring files are only staged when tests fail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Gui_NUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

VerifierSettings.IgnoreMember<IgnoreExplicitTarget>(_ => _.PropertyThatThrows);

TITLE: Azure DevOps Yaml for Handling Test Failures
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration for Azure DevOps adds a task that sets a flag indicating test failure, which is used later to conditionally copy and publish Verify's received files as build artifacts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Cli_NUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Configuring Text File Convention for Files Without Extensions
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use AddTextFileConvention to treat specific files without extensions as text files during verification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/verify-directory.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
[ModuleInitializer]
public static void InitTextFileConvention() =>
    FileExtensions.AddTextFileConvention(
        path =>
        {
            var name = Path.GetFileName(path);
            return name.Equals("TextDocWithoutExtension", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase);
        });
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Cli_Expecto_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: Upload Test Results
  if: failure()
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: verify-test-results
    path: |
      **/*.received.*
```

TITLE: Configuring EditorConfig for Verify Text Files
DESCRIPTION: This EditorConfig snippet provides settings for text editors to maintain consistency when editing Verify's snapshot files (`*.received.*` and `*.verified.*` with common text extensions). It enforces UTF-8 with BOM encoding, LF line endings, and prevents trailing whitespace or final newlines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Cli_Expecto_None.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: editorconfig
CODE:
```
# Verify settings
[*.{received,verified}.{json,txt,xml}]
charset = "utf-8-bom"
end_of_line = lf
indent_size = unset
indent_style = unset
insert_final_newline = false
tab_width = unset
trim_trailing_whitespace = false
```

TITLE: Sample Verify Test Implementation with XUnit v3
DESCRIPTION: A complete example of a Verify test using XUnit v3. The test demonstrates how to create a simple Person object and verify its serialized form using the Verify framework.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_XunitV3_AppVeyor.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public class Tests
{
    [Fact]
    public Task Test()
    {
        var person = new Person
        {
            GivenNames = "John",
            FamilyName = "Smith",
            Spouse = "Jill",
            Address = new Address
            {
                Street = "4 Puddle Lane",
                Country = "USA"
            }
        };

        return Verify(person);
    }
}

public class Person
{
    public string GivenNames { get; set; }
    public string FamilyName { get; set; }
    public string Spouse { get; set; }
    public Address Address { get; set; }
}

public class Address
{
    public string Street { get; set; }
    public string Country { get; set; }
}
```

Automatically configures custom diffing behavior for all Verify operations.

TITLE: Configuring Fixie Test Project for Verify Integration
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of ITestProject and IExecution interfaces to properly configure Fixie for use with Verify, including setting up the target assembly and execution state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Gui_Fixie_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
public class TestProject :
    ITestProject,
    IExecution
{
    public void Configure(TestConfiguration configuration, TestEnvironment environment)
    {
        VerifierSettings.AssignTargetAssembly(environment.Assembly);
        configuration.Conventions.Add<DefaultDiscovery, TestProject>();
    }

    public async Task Run(TestSuite testSuite)
    {
        foreach (var testClass in testSuite.TestClasses)
        {
            foreach (var test in testClass.Tests)
            {
                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()
                                 .Select(_ => _.Parameters))
                    {
                        using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, parameters))
                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);
                        }
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Publishing Verify Received Files as Build Artifacts in Azure DevOps Pipeline
DESCRIPTION: This YAML task publishes the staged .received files as build artifacts when the 'publishverify' variable is set to 'Yes'. It creates an artifact named 'Verify' containing all the .received files generated during failed tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_MSTest_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()

                    {

                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);

                }
                else

                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }

}

TITLE: Defining Character Mappings (JSON-like)

TITLE: Copying Verify Received Files to Artifact Staging in Azure DevOps Pipeline (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: This task copies all *.received.* files to the artifact staging directory. It only executes when the 'publishverify' variable is set to 'Yes'. The task uses wildcards to select files and cleans the target folder before copying.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/build-server-azuredevops.include.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Test Method for Browser Automation in Java
DESCRIPTION: A TestNG test method that opens a specific browser, navigates to Google.com, verifies the page title, and then searches for a term. The browser type is passed as a parameter and the method handles browser initialization through the selectBrowserDriver method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/VerifyDirectoryTests.WithDirectory/target#00.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
@Test
    public void BrowserTest(String browserName) {
        // Select and initialize the browser driver
        selectBrowserDriver(browserName);

        // Navigate to a URL
        driver.get("https://www.google.com");

        // Verify the page title
        String pageTitle = driver.getTitle();
        System.out.println("Page Title: " + pageTitle);

        // Perform a search
        driver.findElement(By.name("q")).sendKeys("Selenium WebDriver");
        driver.findElement(By.name("q")).submit();

        // Close the browser
        driver.quit();
    }
```

public void DateTimeOffset_1()

    Assert.AreEqual(0, d1.CompareTo(d2));
}

TITLE: Sample TUnit Test with VerifyTests
DESCRIPTION: A complete example showing how to implement a simple test using VerifyTests with TUnit. The test demonstrates verifying an object with custom settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_TUnit_None.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
[Test]
public Task Test()
{
    var person = new Person("John", "Smith");

    // Start with a clean verify settings
    var settings = new VerifySettings();
    
    // Add scrubbers
    settings.AddScrubber(s => s.Replace("John", "[Scrubbed]"));
    
    // The type VerifyTUnit provides extension methods for TUnit
    return Verifier.Verify(person, settings);
}

public class Person
{
    public Person(string firstName, string lastName)
    {
        FirstName = firstName;
        LastName = lastName;
    }

    public string FirstName { get; }
    public string LastName { get; }
}
```

TITLE: Complete Sample XUnit Test Using Verify
DESCRIPTION: A complete example of an XUnit test that uses the Verify framework to snapshot test a Person object with various properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_Xunit_AppVeyor.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
using VerifyXunit;

[UsesVerify]
public class Sample
{
    [Fact]
    public Task Test()
    {
        var person = new Person
        {
            GivenNames = "John",
            FamilyName = "Smith",
            Spouse = "Jill",
            Address = new Address
            {
                Street = "1 Puddle Lane",
                Country = "USA"
            }
        };

        return Verifier.Verify(person);
    }
}

public class Address
{
    public string? Street { get; set; }
    public string? Country { get; set; }
}

public class Person
{
    public string? GivenNames { get; set; }
    public string? FamilyName { get; set; }
    public string? Spouse { get; set; }
    public Address? Address { get; set; }
}
```

TITLE: Publishing Verify .received Files as Artifacts in Azure DevOps YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines a task to publish the staged .received files as build artifacts. It only executes if the publishverify flag is set to 'Yes', ensuring artifacts are only published when tests fail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Cli_MSTest_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: EditorConfig for Text Snapshots  EditorConfig
DESCRIPTION: Sample EditorConfig section tailored for received and verified snapshot files. It specifies UTF-8 BOM encoding, LF line endings, and disables common whitespace/indent formatting, matching Verify recommendations. Place this in your .editorconfig file to aid consistent editing of snapshot files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Cli_Fixie_None.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: editorconfig
CODE:
```
# Verify settings\n[*.{received,verified}.{json,txt,xml}]\ncharset = \"utf-8-bom\"\nend_of_line = lf\nindent_size = unset\nindent_style = unset\ninsert_final_newline = false\ntab_width = unset\ntrim_trailing_whitespace = false
```

TITLE: Testing DateTime Conversion Between Time Zones in C#
DESCRIPTION: This test method demonstrates converting a DateTime from one time zone to another. It creates a DateTime in the Pacific Standard Time zone and converts it to Eastern Standard Time, asserting the correct conversion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/DateScrubberTests.VariableLengthDateTimes_trailing.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
[Test]
public void DateTime_ConvertTimeZone()
{
    var pacificTime = TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById("Pacific Standard Time");
    var easternTime = TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById("Eastern Standard Time");
    var dt = new DateTime(2010, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0);
    var dtPacific = TimeZoneInfo.ConvertTime(dt, pacificTime);
    var dtEastern = TimeZoneInfo.ConvertTime(dtPacific, pacificTime, easternTime);
    Assert.That(dtEastern, Is.EqualTo(new DateTime(2010, 1, 1, 3, 0, 0)));
}
```

    IExecution
{
    public void Configure(TestConfiguration configuration, TestEnvironment environment)
    {
        VerifierSettings.AssignTargetAssembly(environment.Assembly);
        configuration.Conventions.Add<DefaultDiscovery, TestProject>();
    }

    public async Task Run(TestSuite testSuite)
    {
        foreach (var testClass in testSuite.TestClasses)
        {
            foreach (var test in testClass.Tests)
            {
                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()
                                 .Select(_ => _.Parameters))
                    {
                        using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, parameters))
                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);
                        }
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Publishing Verify Received Files as Artifacts in Azure DevOps (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet publishes the staged *.received.* files as build artifacts. Like the previous step, it's conditional on the publishverify flag, ensuring artifacts are only published when tests fail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_Xunit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Setting Flag for Publishing Verify Files on Test Failure in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: A YAML task that sets a pipeline variable when tests fail, which will be used to conditionally publish Verify's .received files. This uses Azure DevOps' failed() condition to execute only when the previous test task fails.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Gui_NUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'
```

TITLE: Fixie Test Project Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of ITestProject and IExecution interfaces for configuring Verify with Fixie test runner.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Cli_Fixie_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
public class TestProject :
    ITestProject,
    IExecution
{
    public void Configure(TestConfiguration configuration, TestEnvironment environment)
    {
        VerifierSettings.AssignTargetAssembly(environment.Assembly);
        configuration.Conventions.Add<DefaultDiscovery, TestProject>();
    }

    public async Task Run(TestSuite testSuite)
    {
        foreach (var testClass in testSuite.TestClasses)
        {
            foreach (var test in testClass.Tests)
            {
                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()
                                 .Select(_ => _.Parameters))
                    {
                        using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, parameters))
                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);
                        }
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Deleting a Value from a Binary Search Tree in Java
DESCRIPTION: A recursive method to delete a specific value from a binary search tree. If the node to delete has two children, it finds the minimum value in the right subtree to replace the deleted node, maintaining the BST property. Returns the modified tree after deletion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Expecto.DerivePaths.Tests/Relative/Tests.Test.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
static Node delete(Node tree, int x) {
    if (tree == null) return null;
    if (x < tree.value) {
        tree.left = delete(tree.left, x);
        return tree;
    }
    if (x > tree.value) {
        tree.right = delete(tree.right, x);
        return tree;
    }
    // tree.value == x
    if (tree.left == null) return tree.right;
    if (tree.right == null) return tree.left;
    tree.value = minValue(tree.right);
    tree.right = delete(tree.right, tree.value);
    return tree;
}
```

TITLE: Recommended .gitattributes Settings for Verify Testing Framework
DESCRIPTION: The recommended .gitattributes configuration for the Verify testing framework. These settings ensure that verified output files are handled with consistent line endings (LF) and UTF-8 encoding, which is critical for cross-platform test verification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/InnerVerifyChecksTests/VerifyChecksTests.GitAttributes.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: gitattributes
CODE:
```
# Verify
*.verified.txt text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
*.verified.json text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up EditorConfig for Verify Files
DESCRIPTION: EditorConfig settings for verified and received files to ensure consistent formatting with UTF-8 BOM encoding, LF line endings, and no final newline.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Cli_Xunit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: editorconfig
CODE:
```
# Verify settings
[*.{received,verified}.{json,txt,xml}]
charset = "utf-8-bom"
end_of_line = lf
indent_size = unset
indent_style = unset
insert_final_newline = false
tab_width = unset
trim_trailing_whitespace = false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Git Attributes for Verified Files
DESCRIPTION: This gitattributes configuration ensures that text-based verified files use consistent line endings (LF) and UTF-8 encoding, which is required for reliable verification across different platforms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Other_Gui_MSTest_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: gitattributes
CODE:
```
*.verified.txt text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
*.verified.xml text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
*.verified.json text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
```

TITLE: Set Azure DevOps flag for Verify received files
DESCRIPTION: Configures Azure DevOps to publish 'received' files as build artifacts when a test step fails. This involves setting a variable flag checked in subsequent steps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_Xunit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'

TITLE: Fixie Test Project Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of ITestProject and IExecution interfaces to configure Verify with Fixie test framework.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_Fixie_AppVeyor.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
public class TestProject :
    ITestProject,
    IExecution
{
    public void Configure(TestConfiguration configuration, TestEnvironment environment)
    {
        VerifierSettings.AssignTargetAssembly(environment.Assembly);
        configuration.Conventions.Add<DefaultDiscovery, TestProject>();
    }

    public async Task Run(TestSuite testSuite)
    {
        foreach (var testClass in testSuite.TestClasses)
        {
            foreach (var test in testClass.Tests)
            {
                if (test.HasParameters)
                {
                    foreach (var parameters in test
                                 .GetAll<TestCase>()
                                 .Select(_ => _.Parameters))
                    {
                        using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, parameters))
                        {
                            await test.Run(parameters);
                        }
                    }
                }
                else
                {
                    using (ExecutionState.Set(testClass, test, null))
                    {
                        await test.Run();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps Pipeline Step for Publishing Received Files
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for an Azure DevOps pipeline step that publishes received files as build artifacts when tests fail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Rider_Cli_NUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GitHub Actions Configuration for Uploading Received Files
DESCRIPTION: GitHub Actions workflow step to upload *.received.* files as artifacts when tests fail, which is crucial for debugging verification failures in CI environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_NUnit_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: Upload Test Results
  if: failure()
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: verify-test-results
    path: |
      **/*.received.*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Publishing Verify Received Files as Artifacts on Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet publishes the staged Verify *.received.* files as build artifacts. It runs only if the publishverify flag is set to 'Yes'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Gui_MSTest_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Configuring AppVeyor to Store Received Files as Artifacts

TITLE: Uploading Verify Test Results in GitHub Actions
DESCRIPTION: Configures a GitHub Actions step to upload *.received.* files as artifacts when tests fail. This helps in debugging failed Verify tests in CI/CD pipelines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Other_Gui_TUnit_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

CODE:

  if: failure()
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: verify-test-results
    path: |
      **/*.received.*
```

TITLE: Setting Test Failure Flag in Azure DevOps Pipeline

CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'
```

TITLE: Complete F# Test Module Implementation

CODE:

module Tests

open Xunit
open VerifyTests
open VerifyXunit
open Argon

VerifierSettings.AddExtraSettings(fun settings -> settings.DefaultValueHandling <- DefaultValueHandling.Include)

[<Fact>]
let MyTest () =
     Verifier.Verify(15).ToTask() |> Async.AwaitTask

[<Fact>]
let WithFluentSetting () =
    Verifier
        .Verify(15)
        .UseMethodName("customName")
        .ToTask()
    |> Async.AwaitTask
do ()
```

TITLE: Finding Minimum Value in a Binary Search Tree in Java
DESCRIPTION: A helper method that finds the minimum value in a binary search tree. It traverses the leftmost path of the tree since the minimum value in a BST is always at the leftmost node. This function is used in the deletion operation to find a replacement node.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Expecto.DerivePaths.Tests/Relative/Tests.Test.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
static int minValue(Node tree) {
    while (tree.left != null)
        tree = tree.left;
    return tree.value;
}
```

TITLE: Copying Verify .received Files to Artifact Staging
DESCRIPTION: Copies all *.received.* files to the artifact staging directory when tests have failed. This step only runs when the publishverify flag was set in the previous step, and prepares the files for publication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Rider_Gui_MSTest_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

        public decimal Height { get; }
    }
}

TITLE: Configuring Editor Settings via EditorConfig
DESCRIPTION: This EditorConfig snippet provides suggested settings for editors to handle VerifyTests' text-based received and verified files (`.json`, `.txt`, `.xml`). It enforces UTF-8 with BOM encoding, LF line endings, and prevents trailing newlines or whitespace trimming, aligning with Verify's conventions. Users should add other text extensions as needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Cli_Expecto_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: editorconfig
CODE:
```
# Verify settings
[*.{received,verified}.{json,txt,xml}]
charset = "utf-8-bom"
end_of_line = lf
indent_size = unset
indent_style = unset
insert_final_newline = false
tab_width = unset
trim_trailing_whitespace = false
```

DESCRIPTION: PowerShell script for AppVeyor's on_failure build step to capture and upload all .received files as artifacts for inspection.

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
on_failure:
  - ps: Get-ChildItem *.received.* -recurse | % { Push-AppveyorArtifact $_.FullName -FileName $_.Name }
```

TITLE: Publishing Verify Files as Artifacts in Azure DevOps YAML
DESCRIPTION: Publishes the staged Verify *.received.* files as build artifacts in Azure DevOps pipeline when the publishverify flag is set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_Fixie_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Testing DateTimeOffset Creation and Comparison in C#
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a test method to create DateTimeOffset objects and compare them. It verifies that DateTimeOffset.Now creates a non-UTC value and compares it with a UTC-converted version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/DateScrubberTests.DateTimeOffsets_trailing.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
[Fact]
public void DateTimeOffset_Now_IsNotUtc()
{
    var now = DateTimeOffset.Now;
    Assert.NotEqual(TimeSpan.Zero, now.Offset);
    Assert.NotEqual(now, now.ToUniversalTime());
}
```

TITLE: Running Verify Checks with Fixie
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to run Verify checks using Fixie conventions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/wiz/Windows_VisualStudio_Gui_Fixie_GitHubActions.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public class VerifyConvention : Discovery, Execution
{
    public VerifyConvention()
    {
        // Discover tests
        Methods.Where(method => method.IsPublic && !method.IsStatic);
    }

    public async Task Run(TestClass testClass, MethodInfo method)
    {
        await VerifierSettings.RunChecks(testClass.Type);
        // Run the test
        await method.Invoke(testClass.Instance, null);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps Pipeline Configuration for Verify
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for Azure DevOps pipeline to handle Verify's received files when tests fail.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Other_Gui_XunitV3_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'

- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true

- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Defining Verification Test Parameters in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON object defines configuration settings or expected output for a verification test. It includes properties like 'Include', 'Field', 'Property', 'PropertyByName', 'GetOnlyProperty', and 'PropertyThatThrows'. Values marked as '{Scrubbed}' likely indicate that the actual value should be ignored or replaced during the verification process, often used for sensitive or dynamically generated data. The 'PropertyThatThrows' key suggests a test case involving expected exceptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/Serialization/SerializationTests.ScrubMemberByNameFluent.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  Include: Value,
  Field: {Scrubbed},
  Property: {Scrubbed},
  PropertyByName: {Scrubbed},
  GetOnlyProperty: asd,
  PropertyThatThrows: {Scrubbed}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Nested Objects with Diverse Key-Value Variants in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet defines an object with nested property combinations, including cases with null as a key or value, single and multiple key-value pairs, and properties with values as plain strings, comma-separated lists, or null. It requires standard JavaScript and does not import or depend on any outside library. The object showcases differences in possible property assignment scenarios and can be used to test how JavaScript structures and interprets object definitions with unconventional keys or values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/Serialization/SerializationTests.NameValueCollection.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{
  item1: {
    null: null
  },
  item2: {
    key: null
  },
  item3: {
    null: value
  },
  item4: {
    key: value
  },
  item5: {
    key: value1,value2
  },
  item6: {
    key: value2
  },
  item7: {
    key: value1
  },
  item8: {
    key1: value1,
    key2: value2
  }
}

TITLE: Uploading Verify Test Results on Failure in GitHub Actions
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines a GitHub Actions step that uploads all *.received.* files as artifacts when a build fails. This is particularly useful for debugging verification tests that fail during CI, as it provides access to the actual outputs that didn't match expectations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Rider_Cli_Fixie_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: Upload Test Results
  if: failure()
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: verify-test-results
    path: |
      **/*.received.*
```

TITLE: Inline GUID Scrubbing - Instance Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to enable inline GUID scrubbing for a specific test instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/guids.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
[Fact]
public Task ScrubInlineGuidsInstance()
{
    var settings = new VerifySettings();
    settings.ScrubInlineGuids();
    return Verify(
        "content 651ad409-fc30-4b12-a47e-616d3f953e4c content",
        settings);
}
```

TITLE: GitHub Actions Artifact Upload Configuration
DESCRIPTION: GitHub Actions workflow configuration to upload received files on test failure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Rider_Cli_NUnit_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: Upload Test Results
  if: failure()
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: verify-test-results
    path: |
      **/*.received.*
```

TITLE: Verifying Conventions with Expecto
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to check Verify conventions by calling VerifyChecks.Run() in an Expecto test.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/wiz/Windows_Rider_Cli_Expecto_None.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```

let VerifyConventions () =
    task {
        let result = VerifyChecks.run ()
        if result.HasError then
            return! task { raise (Exception(result.ToString())) }
    }
```

TITLE: Defining Input-Output Mapping Table with Tuples - Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates a mapping object where each key is a tuple of three values (a string, an integer, and a boolean) and each corresponding value is a unique identifier string. There are no external dependencies, and the structure relies on a JSON-like format. Inputs are the tuple keys; outputs are the mapped identifier values. Keys are not quoted per strict JSON, so this representation may not be valid JSON, and parsing may require customization. Make sure tuple parsing logic handles the mix of types correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.XunitV3.Tests/CombinationTests.Three.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Cli_TUnit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: gitignore
CODE:
```
*.received.*
```

TITLE: Configuring Git Attributes for Verified Files
DESCRIPTION: Git attributes configuration to ensure consistent line endings and file encoding for verified files, which helps prevent false test failures due to platform-specific differences.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Other_Gui_TUnit_AppVeyor.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
*.verified.txt text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
*.verified.xml text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
*.verified.json text eol=lf working-tree-encoding=UTF-8
```

TITLE: Setting Flag for Publishing Verify Files in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for Azure DevOps to set a flag when tests fail, used to determine whether to publish Verify's received files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Linux_Other_Cli_XunitV3_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'
```

TITLE: Implementing Custom Path Derivation for AppVeyor
DESCRIPTION: C# implementation for custom path derivation when test assemblies are copied to different directories in AppVeyor builds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/build-server.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: cs
CODE:
```
if (BuildServerDetector.Detected)
{
    var buildDirectory = Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("APPVEYOR_BUILD_FOLDER")!;
    DerivePathInfo(
        (sourceFile, projectDirectory, typeName, methodName) =>
        {
            var testDirectory = Path.GetDirectoryName(sourceFile)!;
            var testDirectorySuffix = testDirectory.Replace(projectDirectory, string.Empty);
            return new(directory: Path.Combine(buildDirectory, testDirectorySuffix));
        });
}
```

TITLE: Setting Flag on Test Failure in Azure DevOps Pipeline
DESCRIPTION: This YAML task sets a pipeline variable 'publishverify' to 'Yes' when the test step fails. It uses the Azure DevOps condition feature to only run on test failure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_MSTest_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'
```

TITLE: Disabling Resharper/Rider Orphaned Process Detection - DotSettings XML
DESCRIPTION: Add this XML setting to your [Solution].sln.DotSettings file to prevent Rider or ReSharper from prompting about lingering child processes spawned by tests. This is particularly useful for Verify, as it may launch diff tools that persist after test completion. Adjust for solution-wide or per-machine settings as needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/MacOS_Rider_Gui_MSTest_GitHubActions.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<s:String x:Key=\"/Default/Housekeeping/UnitTestingMru/UnitTestRunner/SpawnedProcessesResponse/@EntryValue\">DoNothing</s:String>
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps Pipeline Configuration for Verify
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for Azure DevOps pipeline to handle Verify's received files when tests fail. Includes steps for flagging test failures, copying received files, and publishing artifacts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Cli_Fixie_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes'
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Azure DevOps Pipeline: Set Variable if Test Step Fails - yaml
DESCRIPTION: Azure DevOps YAML task that sets a variable 'publishverify' to 'Yes' if the previous test step failed. This variable is used to conditionally trigger subsequent steps for publishing Verify '*.received.*' artifacts. Intended for inclusion right after the test-run step in a pipeline definition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudio_Cli_Xunit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CmdLine@2\n  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'\n  condition: failed()\n  inputs:\n    script: 'echo \"##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes\"'\n
```

TITLE: Copying Verify .received Files to Artifact Staging in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines a task to copy all .received files to an artifact staging directory. It only executes if the publishverify flag is set to 'Yes'. This step is necessary because the PublishBuildArtifacts task in Azure DevOps doesn't support wildcards.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Cli_Xunit_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Implementing Static Comparer in Verify Tests
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to register a static comparer method for specific file extensions. This approach is simpler when no state needs to be maintained between comparisons.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/mdsource/comparer.source.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
[ModuleInitializer]
public static void Initialize()
{
    VerifierSettings.RegisterComparer(
        "bmp",
        (received, verified, context) =>
        {
            using var verifiedImage = Image.FromStream(verified);
            using var receivedImage = Image.FromStream(received);
            if (verifiedImage.Size == receivedImage.Size)
            {
                return Task.FromResult(CompareResult.Equal);
            }

            return Task.FromResult(
                CompareResult.NotEqual(
                    $"Image sizes differ. Expected: {verifiedImage.Size}, but was: {receivedImage.Size}"));
        });
    VerifierSettings.RegisterComparer("png", Compare);
    VerifierSettings.RegisterComparer("jpg", Compare);
}
```

TITLE: Setting Flag on Test Failure in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: Sets a pipeline variable when the test runner fails, which will be used to conditionally publish Verify's .received files. This task uses the Azure DevOps pipeline's condition system to execute only on test failure.

- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Set flag to publish Verify *.received.* files when test step fails'
  condition: failed()
  inputs:
    script: 'echo "##vso[task.setvariable variable=publishverify]Yes"'
```

TITLE: Publishing Verify Files as Build Artifacts
DESCRIPTION: Publishes the staged .received files as build artifacts when publishverify flag is set. Uses PublishBuildArtifacts task to make files available in pipeline artifacts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_Rider_Cli_XunitV3_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
  displayName: 'Publish Verify *.received.* files as Artifacts'
  name: 'verifypublish'
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  inputs:
    PathtoPublish: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    ArtifactName: 'Verify'
    publishLocation: 'Container'
```

TITLE: Generating TestContext Property for Non-Generic Test Class in C#
DESCRIPTION: Defines a TestContext property for a non-generic test class TestClass2 within nested namespaces and classes. The property interacts with VerifyMSTest.Verifier for test context management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.MSTest.SourceGenerator.Tests/NamespaceTests.HasAttributeOnClassWithGenericsInNestedNamespace.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
namespace A.B
{
partial class C<T>
{
partial class D
{
partial class TestClass2
{
  [global::System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCodeAttribute("Verify.MSTest.SourceGenerator", "1.0.0.0")]
  public global::Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UnitTesting.TestContext TestContext
  {
    get => global::VerifyMSTest.Verifier.CurrentTestContext.Value!.TestContext;
    set => global::VerifyMSTest.Verifier.CurrentTestContext.Value = new global::VerifyMSTest.TestExecutionContext(value, GetType());
  }
}
}
}
}
```

TITLE: Copying Verify Received Files to Artifact Staging in Azure DevOps
DESCRIPTION: Azure DevOps YAML task that copies all *.received.* files to the artifact staging directory when tests fail, preparing them for publishing.

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Copying Verify Received Files to Artifact Staging
DESCRIPTION: Copies all *.received.* files to the artifact staging directory when the publishverify flag is set. This step is necessary because PublishBuildArtifacts doesn't support wildcards directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/docs/wiz/Windows_VisualStudioWithReSharper_Gui_Expecto_AzureDevOps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- task: CopyFiles@2
  condition: eq(variables['publishverify'], 'Yes')
  displayName: 'Copy Verify *.received.* files to Artifact Staging'
  inputs:
    contents: '**/*.received.*' 
    targetFolder: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/Verify'
    cleanTargetFolder: true
    overWrite: true
```

TITLE: Defining Self-Referencing Property in JavaScript Object
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a JavaScript object where the property 'SelfProperty' is assigned the value of '$parentValue'. It is a typical pattern for referencing scoped or inherited values in configurations or frameworks supporting variable interpolation. There are no explicit dependencies, but the surrounding environment is expected to resolve the $parentValue (e.g., in frameworks like Knockout.js or similar MVVM systems). Inputs: properties or variables available in the parent scope. Output: an object with a property referencing a scoped value. Limitations: $parentValue must be defined in the containing context; otherwise, it will be undefined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/Serialization/SerializationTests.WithRecursiveConverter.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

}

TITLE: Selecting and Initializing Browser Driver in Java
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to select and initialize different browser drivers (Chrome, Firefox, or Edge) based on the provided browser string. It includes the setup for each browser including WebDriver initialization and configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/VerifyDirectoryTests.WithDirectory/target#00.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
public void selectBrowserDriver(String browser) {
        if (browser.trim().equalsIgnoreCase("chrome")) {
            WebDriverManager.chromedriver().setup();
            driver = new ChromeDriver();
        } else if (browser.trim().equalsIgnoreCase("firefox")) {
            WebDriverManager.firefoxdriver().setup();
            driver = new FirefoxDriver();
        } else if (browser.trim().equalsIgnoreCase("edge")) {
            WebDriverManager.edgedriver().setup();
            driver = new EdgeDriver();
        } else {
            // If no browser is specified or an invalid browser is specified,
            // default to Chrome
            WebDriverManager.chromedriver().setup();
            driver = new ChromeDriver();
        }
    }
```

TITLE: Configuring Verify Tests in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration specifies test directories, file patterns to include/exclude, and custom test commands for running verify tests. It defines settings for both the 'verify' and 'verify-changed' commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Xunit.Tests/Scrubbers/ScrubberLevelsSample.AfterJson.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
verify:
  testDirs:
    - src/test/verify
  include:
    - "**/*.{js,ts,json}"
  exclude:
    - "**/node_modules/**"
  update:
    - yarn test:verify-update

verify-changed:
  testDirs:
    - src/test/verify
  include:
    - "**/*.{js,ts,json}"
  exclude:
    - "**/node_modules/**"
  update:
    - yarn test:verify-update
```

TITLE: Testing Set Operations in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet verifies various set operations in Python, including creation, adding and removing elements, and set methods like union, intersection, and difference.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.MSTest.DerivePaths.Tests/Tests.ThrowOnConflict.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
my_set = {1, 2, 3}
assert len(my_set) == 3
assert 1 in my_set
assert 4 not in my_set

my_set.add(4)
assert my_set == {1, 2, 3, 4}
my_set.remove(2)
assert my_set == {1, 3, 4}
popped = my_set.pop()
assert popped in {1, 3, 4}
assert len(my_set) == 2

set1 = {1, 2, 3}
set2 = {3, 4, 5}
assert set1.union(set2) == {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}
assert set1.intersection(set2) == {3}
assert set1.difference(set2) == {1, 2}
assert set1.symmetric_difference(set2) == {1, 2, 4, 5}

set1.update({4, 5, 6})
assert set1 == {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}
set1.intersection_update({3, 4, 5, 6})
assert set1 == {3, 4, 5, 6}
set1.difference_update({4, 5})
assert set1 == {3, 6}

set1.clear()
assert set1 == set()
```

TITLE: Running Multiple Tests with the Testing Framework

    {"name": "addition_test", "inputs": [10, 5], "expected_output": 15},
    {"name": "subtraction_test", "inputs": [10, 5], "expected_output": 5}
]

# Run the tests
for test in tests:
    if "addition" in test["name"]:
        run_test(test, add)
    elif "subtraction" in test["name"]:
        run_test(test, subtract)
```

TITLE: Implementing a Line Class with perpendicular line calculation in C++
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines a Line class with methods to manipulate and analyze geometric lines. It includes a method to find a perpendicular line passing through a given point, as well as properties for calculating slope, y-intercept, and line equation parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/verifytests/verify/blob/main/src/Verify.Tests/Serialization/SerializationTests.ScrubEmptyLineEnd.verified.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
```
class Line {
public:
	Line();
	Line(Point start, Point end);
	Line(double a, double b, double c);

	double DistanceFromPoint(Point p);
	Point ProjectOn(Point point);

	Point IntersectWith(Line line);
	Line GetPerpendicularLineFrom(Point p);

	Point GetStart() { return start; }
	Point GetEnd() { return end; }

	double GetA() { return a; }
	double GetB() { return b; }
	double GetC() { return c; }

	double GetSlope();
	double GetYIntercept();

	bool IsVertical() { return isVertical; }

	void SetStart(Point p) { start = p; }
	void SetEnd(Point p) { end = p; }

	void SetA(double _a) { a = _a; }
	void SetB(double _b) { b = _b; }
	void SetC(double _c) { c = _c; }

private:
	Point start;
	Point end;

	double a;
	double b;
	double c;

	bool isVertical;
};
```
